name: timberline
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in an area of high ground or in the extreme north or south of the world, the point above or past which trees do not grow : We were on the mountaintops, above the timberline. At an elevation of 8,000 feet above sea level, the valley was just below the timberline. It is estimated that 90 percent of Colorado's 3.2 million acres of protected wilderness are near or above timberline. They were on a high plateau between the timber line and the permanent snowline. Synonym
tree line
in an area of high ground or in the extreme north or south of the world, the point above or past which trees do not grow close together and form a canopy (= a roof) with their top branches: Between the timber line and the tree line, the trees are stunted and do not achieve full growth.
